items._description: A powerful claw weapon designed for a mighty Guardian.
But vipers don't even HAVE claws!!1
A sharp claw-like weapon, fashioned after the ferocious talons of mighty birds of prey.
It's a type of claw weapon, but it doesn't look like it's designed for human use... This particular one is particularly effective against undead.
A curved dagger.
A basic iron dagger.
A powerful doublesword which inflicts bonus damage against Moral elemental opponents.
A doublesword with a bird wing motif. It's air elemental.
An exotic weapon with crescent hook-like blades at either end.
A doublesword fashioned in the shape of trilobites for some reason.
A double-bladed sword made of the bones of some great dead beast, meant for slicing the bones of other great beasts. It's especially effective versus undead.
A double-bladed sword from lands afar.
A powerful axe, forged from Red Dragon Scales, traditionally used by the most powerful of Reptoid Chieftains.
Though it may look very primitive, there's no denying the power of this axe!
An axe shaped like the Eye of YALORT. It's designed for ceremonial purposes, but it still packs a whallop if used in real combat.
A delicately ornate axe forged from the shiniest silver. Like all silver weapons, it's effective against undead.
A primitive but effective axe, made from the thigh bone of a large beast and the pelvis-type thing of some probably different beast, maybe.
A solid, powerful axe made for rending armour.
A greataxe made of... well, you can probably work it out somehow.
A greataxe blessed by Solak, deity of Suns.
A basic greataxe.
A large branch, used as a club.
A powerful blade made of a metal that fell to Belfan in a meteor.
A large, sturdy stick, found on the gr- no! It's a Mighty Hero's Magic Sword, of course! This one is large enough for a child to wield in both hands, like a greatsword.
The sword of a legendary hero.
The sword of Social Fox.
A decorative but powerful sword that was buried with Social Fox in his tomb. It may or may not have belonged to him at some point.
An old sword that was probably used by some Hero in the days of old. It has runes engraved on it.
A large, shiny sword made of mythril.
A simple but powerful greatsword made of iron.
A greatsword made of bronze. It's strong enough to rend rocks in twain.
A basic greatsword.
A simple but powerful gun.
The most basic gun.

A harp with strings made from silver cords which used to harness souls to their corporeal shells. It has a haunting echoey effect when played, as if the sound is coming from another realm of existence entirely.
A delicate harp made by forest spirits, out of forest spirits!

A harp reminiscent of the sea. It's said that these are the types of instruments played by true Sirens to lure men to their deaths. Or maybe they just use their voices...? Either way, it's water elemental. Yay.
A delicate silver harp. It's more effective for playing music on than it is for attacking with.
Mechanical arms, fashioned into whirring buzzsaws to slice into foes.
Mechanical arms, fashioned into hammers specifically for bludgeoning use in combat.
Mechanical arms, designed for picking things up, but also very useful for causing harm to things in combat.
A magical rod that was once used by some great sage or something. It boosts the power of the four natural elements slightly.
A magical rod imbued with the elemental power of air. It increases the power of air spells, and absorbs any damage it inflicts as MP.
A magical rod imbued with the elemental power of earth. It increases the power of earth spells, and absorbs any damage it inflicts as MP.
A magical rod imbued with the elemental power of fire. It increases the power of fire spells, and absorbs any damage it inflicts as MP.
A magical rod imbued with the elemental power of water. It increases the power of water spells, and absorbs any damage it inflicts as MP.
Qualna's weapon.
Moric's scythe.
A powerful, ancient spear with an obelisk-shaped pokey bit.
A simple, magically enchanted spear. Its design is closer to that of a magic staff than a war spear, and as such, it's great for boosting the power of spells, but relatively weak at physical strikes.
A fire elemental spear, tipped with a fang of the Fire Guardian of the Fire Temple. Awarded for defeating that Guardian.
A spear with a venomous wasp stinger stuck on the end. It has a chance of poisoning creatures that it strikes.
A type of ornate spear forged in Aeropolis.
A simple metal spear with no magical enchantments whatsoever.
An ornate spear containing topaz gems.
An ornate spear containing a fire opal.
A simple spear often used by generic, expendable soldiers.
An expensive staff crafted from a fine wood. It has a creepy, unsettling aura to it; it feels like it might suddenly hit you on the head when you're not looking.
A sturdy staff with a trilobite-shaped knob on the end. It is a status symbol, granted to Trilobite Warriors when they prove themselves to be the best of the best.
A branch from a mighty, legendary, celestial tree, crafted into a magical staff.
A two-handed staff with an elemental gem on the head, infused with the powers of Fire.
A two-handed staff with an elemental gem on the head, infused with the powers of Air.
A metal staff with a macehead on the end, used by those magic users that prefer to bludgeon things as well as cast spells.
A two-handed staff with an elemental gem on the head, infused with the powers of Earth.
It has a love heart on the end!

An ancient blade, cursed by some powerful wizard. Whoever wields it is afflicted with the Curse status effect, but so are any enemies that it strikes. It also drains the energy of its victims, but causes its wielder to bleed constantly.
A finely-crafted sword awarded to the Champion of the Arena. It serves as a decorative trophy AND a powerful weapon with a high critical hit chance!
A sword once wielded by the King of Goznor.
A semi-legendary sword used by some great Shaman Hero eons ago. It is said that when he died, a forest grew around his grave, and his sword was lost deep within it. Or something to that effect.
A simple but deadly weapon which is essentially an ornate bronze block on a stick. They're often used by priests for some reason.
A holy sword, forged for and wielded by a legendary Yalortian Paladin of some sort. It is meant to be used to bring justice to evil beings.
A dark, evil sword with vampiric properties. It sucks the blood from the wounds it causes, and uses it to heal the wielder.

A semi-legendary sword apparently made from some kind of magically stunned fish, with skin like steel razors. How eccentric. It WOULD be strong against Fish-type creatures, except that'd be pointless because they usually absorb Water.
A semi-legendary sword said to have been used in some great battle thousands of years ago or somesuch.
A type of scimitar made exclusively in Aeropolis. It's of the Air element.
No, this doesn't have anything to do with Kingdom Hearts. Nothing at all. It's not even a reference to it or anything.
A large, sturdy stick, found on the gr- no! It's a Mighty Hero's Magic Sword, of course! It's short and light enough to wield in one hand like a sword.
A mighty sword wielded by heroes.
A finely-crafted sword awarded to the Champion of the Arena. It serves as a decorative trophy AND a powerful weapon with a high critical hit chance!
These curved swords are forged specially in the reptoid village of Xantusia. They score critical hits more often that straighter swords.
A holy blade blessed by SOLAK, God of Suns. It inflicts Light elemental damage.
A Dark-elemental sword, imbued with eldritch powers, probably.
A sword forged from the highly unique-to-this-setting metal called 'mythril'. It's not an especially exciting sword. Its favourite colour is probably grey.
A weapon consisting of a metal shaft with a spiked metal ball at the end. Used for bludgeoning.
A generic longsword made of iron. It's got a small lapis lazuli in the hilt that doesn't do anything at all!
An ornate sword made of silver. It's magically imbued with the power of light, and inflicts double damage on undead targets.
A sturdy longsword made of bronze.
A basic iron sword.
A stick to assist the elderly in walking.
